attributes.title: No-brainer social proof for any B2B SaaS vendor

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value: As a B2B SaaS marketing veteran, I know how crucial it is to provide prospects with social proof. So I knew I had to get my G2 game up to speed when I started heading the marketing. I'm happy to say G2's team helped me set up my page very quickly and helped me get an initial number of reviews to put my startup on the map. We even won 9 G2 badges just about 3 months after starting.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value: G2 is a must-have for every SaaS that wants to make a real name for itself, and I'm stressing that even though it isn't cheap, it's still worth the investment.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: I work in an industry plagued with distrust, so proving to prospects that I'm a real, authoritative, licensed, and legitimate business is essential. Having the power to generate genuine organic reviews to back me up and prove to the world that I can deliver the quality I promise to deliver has proved essential in my sales funnel. Having a G2 page with all available features such as a pricing deck, video, cover image, etc. along with the reviews I get, promises me the social proof I need for my business.

love.value: G2 becomes a best practice WW. Customers know the platform and understand the importance of sharing reviews. Having great reviews helps our Sales process and improve our service.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value:
If a user does not mention his name while sharing a bad review, you can send a notification, but you won't know the reviewer. In order to improve ourselves, we prefer to reach out to the reviewer directly and have a clear plan with him. In case we know the reviewer, it is straightforward for us to contact and apply a quick mitigation plan.
You can't generate the personal link and follow the incoming reviews per CSM.
For this, we have a great CSM, Jatin Chaudhari, that is doing a great job setting up the scheduled reports.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: All best practices that the CSM is sharing are valuable. We are increasing our footprint every quarter and have a transparent process for improving the G2 reviews. attributes.title: G2 is a great framework

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value:
Working with G2 has a lot of big benefits: 

- They help my team to think, in a more targeted way, about how we're represented in the world. 

- They give us the tools to share our product with a wider audience. 

- They provide a structure for generating feedback in a repeatable way. 

- They generate insight into the browsing patterns of our leads and how our competitors are presenting themselves.

- We've also maintained a very solid relationship with the team at G2 throughout the purchase and onboarding process with Jordan, Will and Akshat. They don't let us rest on our laurels and keep us motivated to do the work and get full value from the platform.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value: There's nothing in our relationship with G2 that I would describe as unhelpful or counter-productive. It's fair to say that we had to invest some time adapting standardized G2 processes to our business, given specifics like our deal sizes, sales cycle, internal capacity etc. but they always met us in the middle with this.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: We needed visibility on trusted external platforms to enable buyer journeys and increase trust from leads. As a business with fairly long deal cycles, we can't start too early when it comes to educating our potential customers. We are also in a position to use intent data in a hugely competitive way to attract business that might otherwise have gone to larger competitors.

G2 has a thriving community of software users, experts, and professionals. Users can actively participate in discussions, ask questions, and seek advice from the community, creating a collaborative environment for knowledge sharing.

 Not to mention the trustworthy ratings and rankings based on real user reviews. This grid particularly, offers a visual representation of software products' market presence and customer satisfaction, enabling users to compare and evaluate different options within specific categories effectively.

This marketplace encourages software vendors to actively engage with users, respond to reviews, and address concerns which fosters vendor accountability and transparency, allowing potential buyers to gauge the vendor's commitment to customer satisfaction.

attributes.title: Good early traction, then fall-off

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value: Great personal account support. Our rep meets with us regularly and tries to do all she can to help us get the most out of the G2 system.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value:
G2 itself is extremely janky. We had to write up & justify the category that we belong in because G2 didn't understand our industry. We needed to explain why we should or shouldn't be tucked up underneath other categories. We needed to explain, in long-form, why certain companies they identified as our competitors should not even *be* in the category they threw them into.

Talking with Monty, he literally could not even recognize our product category and instead provided to me pages of unrelated market segments. When I gave him the exact page in G2 that I was referring to it said "I don't have access to live G2 database but I rely on set of structured database information which I currently lack for [my company's category]."

While we had initial traction in getting reviews once we signed the contract, that dried up quickly (after 1-2 months) and then we haven't gotten *any* reviews in the past half-year.

I wish I got sentiment analytics on the page even if someone *didn't* leave a review. I wish there was a way to know how many users were "watching us" or whether they had a positive brand sentiment. I can see pageviews, but I wish I could tell if folks were "subscribed" to our brand. So we could push updated information to those who had more than passing interest.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: We want a public "score" for our product and have that appear in a place where our competitors also appear. We want to at least be given our fair share of voice. So far G2 has allowed us to be findable in a head-to-head comparison site.

attributes.title: Exceptional Tool for Identifying Purchase Intent

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value:
G2 Intent is an invaluable asset for our team, providing exceptional capabilities in identifying and understanding purchase intent. The insights it provides have been crucial in shaping our strategic decisions and tailoring our approach to potential clients.

The user interface is intuitive, making it easy to navigate and extract valuable data. Real-time alerts keep us informed of potential opportunities, allowing us to engage with prospects at the right moment.

What truly sets G2 Intent apart is the outstanding support from the G2 team. Tai and Edan, from the support team, have been instrumental in providing timely assistance and showing genuine interest in our company's success.

G2 Intent's integrations with tools like Zoominfo and Salesloft have streamlined our workflow, creating a seamless experience for lead generation and marketing programs.

If you're looking for a tool that goes beyond traditional lead generation and provides deep insights into buyer behavior, G2 Intent is the game-changer you need to enhance your sales and marketing strategies.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value: Our experience with G2 Intent has generally been positive. The platform excels in identifying purchase intent, providing valuable insights that have significantly impacted our strategic decisions.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: G2 enables us to not only enhance our brand reputation but also significantly reduce churn by leveraging positive testimonials. Moreover, G2.com provides real-time insights, helping us identify and engage with accounts actively exploring our solutions.

attributes.title: Turnkey tools

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value: G2's marketing tools can adapt to teams of all sizes. They have plenty of features to help scale the customer voice into other teams and systems (e.g. reference pages, quote library, integrations with 6sense). It is simple enough for a team of one to learn quickly, but robust enough for an entire marketing org to find value out of it. More than anything, the direct support I've received from G2 has been huge in my continuing to advocate and find value in the platform. Our Account Manager and Customer Success Manager have become valued professional peers â€” it really feels like I've built a rapport with them. They are patient and not pushy and bring a consultative approach to our partnership.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value: For companies with a large product ecosystem, you may experience limitations with how much you can do across multiple product pages (depending on your subscription). G2 Categories don't always align 1:1 with the products we offer, which can sometimes poorly position us against other companies within the category. As more unique AI products and tools emerge, I'd love to see G2 keep pace with corresponding categories.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: It is helping us increase our brand visibility and social proof at scale, which helps us infuse the voice of the customer into more channels, and increase our reputation and rankings within G2.
